name: Savory Sausage Cups
description: Quick and easy appetizer using Jimmy Dean® pork sausage, cream cheese, and vegetables make a tasty one-bite treat for any get-together. Serve hot or at room temperature.
recipeIngredient: 1 (16 ounce) package Jimmy Dean® Premium Pork Regular Sausage
4 ounces garden vegetable cream cheese, softened
¼ cup finely chopped red bell pepper
¼ cup finely chopped green onion

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Add sausage to a frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook and stir with a spatula, breaking apart the sausage until cooked, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and let cool.
Combine regular and vegetable cream cheese, Cheddar cheese, bell pepper, green onion, and cooled, crumbled sausage in a bowl. Mix well and set aside.
Unroll 1 crescent dough sheet and press into a 9x12-inch rectangle. Cut 6 rows across and 4 rows vertically to yield 24 squares. Repeat with the second package of dough.
Place 1 square in each cup of two nonstick 24-cup mini muffin tins, pressing it into the bottom and up the sides.
Drop 1 heaping teaspoon of sausage filling into each cup. Filling should be up to the top of the cup, but you do not need to press it down.
Bake in the preheated oven until the dough is golden brown, 11 to 13 minutes.
Cool for 5 minutes in the tins before removing to a platter.

review.reviewBody: We thought this was a wonderful recipe!  I would suggest that the ingredients for the cups be made ahead of time and then brought to room temperature before using the small cookie scoop to fill the cups.  I made only half a recipe, and since I am making this during COVID I will have to wait to serve these to friends!  This is the perfect appetizer for parties!  Thanks, Jimmy Dean!  We love your sausage, and we loved these appys!
These were very tasty and easy to make as well.  It made far more filling than was necessary, but other than that no complaints!
This was absolutely wonderful! I don't own a mini muffin pan so I just cut the dough in larger squares and used a regular muffin tin. They were so good, my husband couldn't stop eating them!

I too wanted to sautee the bell pepper and green onions but decided to follow the recipe. I am so glad that I did because there is no need to do so. I made half of the recipe and got exactly 24 mini cups of delicousness. These little cups are scrumptious and so easy to make. Thank you for sharing your recipe.
Everyone loved these appetizers, including the grandkids.

Oh, my goodness!  You will be the "star" cook of the gathering, with these delightful "bitefuls"!  If your little cups don't turn out as lovely and perfect as the submitter's, do not worry.  Once people find out how good they are, they will disappear in a hurry!  I wondered if I should saute the veggies with the sausage, but I followed the recipe to a "T".  After making them, I would never recommend sauteing the veggies.  They  added a subtle crunch that offset the rich cheeses very nicely!  These were nearly addictive--they were THAT good.  Two practical comments:  dough squares will be a tad more than 2" square, and any smaller will not come up the sides of your muffin tin as nicely; and, you can use a shiny muffin tin, but any sausage mixture that gets on the tin will need some attention.
Love these Sausage Cups! Super easy to make and perfect for parties or gatherings!  I even froze some for New Years Eve!

These sausage cups are great appetizers. I made half the batch with sweet Hawaiian crescent rolls. The sweet were my favorite. But, not a huge difference in taste. I had leftover filling. So, grab an extra package of crescent to finish the filling. I used a cookie scoop and they were very easy to fill.

11.24.20 I used a pizza cutter for cutting the dough sheets into squares and a small cookie scoop for filling the cups which worked really well.  I filled up the cups, had a little bit left over, so went back and piled more of the sausage mixture on the top.  A few overflowed, but no big deal.  These are creamy, a little tangy, and definitely tasty with lovely presentation.  A keeper for sure, 5 stars!
